span.br: Caledonia Area Public Schools (CAPS) is continuing to monitor the situation regarding the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) as it continues to evolve.

br.br:
Schools have been directed to begin Distance Learning plans beginning March 30th and will continue to deliver Distance Learning until at least May 5th. At present, the Governor’s order has us returning to school in a face to face manner on May 5th. May 1st and 4th would be non-school days to allow staff to plan for the return of the students on May 5th.
COVID-19 Updates from our Superintendent Craig Ihrke

WHAT IS COVID-19?
Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. The virus that causes COVID-19 is a novel coronavirus that was first identified during an investigation into an outbreak in Wuhan, China and has now been detected in the United States. Source: CDC
